meanings.definition: A synthetic compound used as a stimulant to increase alertness and focus.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed amphetamine to help the patient stay awake during the day.
meanings.sent2: Athletes sometimes misuse amphetamine to enhance their performance in sports.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel accidentally ingested amphetamine and started running around the park in circles.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project was like an amphetamine, driving her to work tirelessly day and night.
meanings.sent5: The effect of the amphetamine was immediate, making him feel more awake and attentive.

meanings.definition: A drug that stimulates the central nervous system, commonly used to treat ADHD and narcolepsy.
meanings.sent1: The pharmacist explained how amphetamine works to increase focus in individuals with ADHD.
meanings.sent2: Doctors carefully monitor the dosage of amphetamine to avoid any potential side effects.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally knocked over the bottle of amphetamine pills, causing quite a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The music had an amphetamine-like effect on the crowd, energizing everyone to dance non-stop.
meanings.sent5: The amphetamine medication helped the patient manage their narcolepsy symptoms effectively.
